item.title: Huddle rooms equipped with video capabilities have the potential to enhance collaboration
item.description:
India, China, and Singapore are leading the way in Asia Pacific when it comes to using collaboration technology in huddle rooms (small meeting rooms). However, there’s still a significant opportunity to boost productivity further through advanced collaboration tools. A new study by Polycom (now a part of Plantronics) reveals that although content sharing is the preferred collaboration method for Singaporean workers, the country’s adoption of video conferencing lags behind other countries in the region...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/huddle-rooms-equipped-with-video-capabilities-have-the-potential-to-enhance-collaboration/

item.title: VoIP That Sounds Better Than TDM Phone Calls
item.description:
It’s a common belief that VoIP calls are inferior to traditional phone calls using TDM technology. Some even believe VoIP limitations make it impossible to match TDM’s voice quality. However, this is a misconception. VoIP has the potential to sound significantly better than TDM, even reaching high-fidelity music quality. The negative perception of VoIP stems from early experiences with low-quality PC softphones and dial-up internet. While these were acceptable for free international calls, their poor sound quality became problematic when marketed as a replacement for traditional phone lines...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/voip-that-sounds-better-than-tdm-phone-calls/

item.title: How HD Audio Will Transform VoIP
item.description:
People who recall the era of analog phones and physical switches often feel nostalgic about the superior audio quality of those systems. The conversations back then possessed a clarity and immediacy that has largely vanished in recent times, though this might be changing soon. A new movement is underway to enhance the fidelity of VoIP calls significantly, aiming to make current phones seem primitive in comparison. This advancement is known as high-definition audio or HD Voice, a term used by Polycom, a manufacturer of IP phones equipped with this technology...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/how-hd-audio-will-transform-voip/
